# R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
 
library(plotly)

fig <- plot_ly(
  type = 'scatterpolar',
  r = c(0,1,2,3),
  theta = c(0,45,90,135),
    mode = 'lines+markers', marker = list(size = 10),
  fill = 'toself'
)


fig <- fig %>%
  layout()
  
fig 
```

```{r}
 
  library(plotly)
fig <- plot_ly(
  type = 'scatterpolar',
  r = c(0,1,2,3),
  theta = c(0,45,90,135),
   marker = list(size = 10,color="red"),
  lines = list(size = 10,color="black"),
  fill = 'toself'
) 
fig <- fig %>%
  layout(
    polar = list(
      radialaxis = list(
        visible = T,
        range = c(0,3),
          angle=90,
        color = 'grey',
        nticks = 4,
        tickcolor =toRGB('blue')
      )
    )
  )

fig  


```
